two_sum.title: Two Sum
two_sum.description: Implement a function that locates a pair of elements within an integer array whose sum equals a specified target value. The function should return the array indices of these two elements. Assume exactly one valid pair exists and that no element may be used twice in the solution.

testCases.description: should return indices [0, 1] because nums[0] + nums[1] = 2 + 7 = 9
should return indices [1, 2] because nums[1] + nums[2] = 2 + 4 = 6
should return indices [0, 1] because nums[0] + nums[1] = 3 + 3 = 6

maximum_subarray.title: Maximum Subarray
maximum_subarray.description: Design an algorithm to determine the maximum sum achievable from any contiguous subsequence within an array of integers. The array contains both positive and negative values. While a brute-force approach examining all possible subarrays runs in O(nÂ²) time, strive for an optimal O(n) solution using constant space.

testCases.description: should return the largest subsum
should return the largest subsum

unique_paths.title: Unique Paths
unique_paths.description: Develop a recursive algorithm to count the total number of distinct shortest paths through a rectangular grid from the top-left corner to the bottom-right corner. Movement is restricted to rightward and downward steps only. Implement memoization to optimize the recursive solution and avoid redundant calculations.

parameters.name: rows
parameters.description: Number of rows in the grid

parameters.name: columns
parameters.description: Number of columns in the grid

testCases.description: should return 28 unique paths for 3x7 grid
should return 364 unique paths for 4x12 grid
should return 3060 unique paths for 5x15 grid

coin_change.title: Coin Change
coin_change.description: Construct an algorithm that determines the minimum number of coins needed to make change for a given monetary amount. Given a set of coin denominations and a target amount, return an array containing the specific coins that sum to the target using the fewest possible coins. Implement this as a classic dynamic programming optimization problem.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Target monetary amount to make change for

testCases.description: should return [25, 10, 1] using minimum 3 coins for 36 cents
should return [25, 10, 5, 1, 1, 1] using minimum 6 coins for 43 cents
should return [25, 25, 10, 5, 1, 1] using minimum 6 coins for 67 cents

contains_duplicate.title: Contains Duplicate
contains_duplicate.description: Analyze an integer array to determine whether any value appears more than once. Return true if at least one duplicate exists, false if all elements are distinct. Design an efficient solution that can handle arrays with up to 100,000 elements containing values in the range of negative one billion to positive one billion.

parameters.name: nums
parameters.description: Array of integers to check for duplicates

testCases.description: should return true when element 1 appears at indices 0 and 3
should return false when all elements are distinct
should return true when multiple elements have duplicates

best_time_to_buy_and_sell_stock.title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock
best_time_to_buy_and_sell_stock.description: Determine the optimal strategy for a single stock transaction to maximize profit. Given an array representing stock prices over consecutive days, identify the most profitable buy-sell pair where the purchase precedes the sale. The algorithm should find the maximum difference between a selling price and a buying price, with the constraint that the buying day must occur before the selling day. If no profitable transaction exists, return zero.

parameters.name: prices
parameters.description: Array of stock prices where prices[i] represents the price on day i

testCases.description: should return 5 by buying at price 1 and selling at price 6
should return 0 when prices only decrease
should return 4 by buying at price 1 and selling at price 5

valid_parentheses.title: Valid Parentheses
valid_parentheses.description: Construct an algorithm to validate the proper matching and ordering of bracket characters within a string. Given a string containing only parentheses, square brackets, and curly braces, determine whether the brackets are correctly paired and nested. Each opening bracket must have a corresponding closing bracket of the same type, and brackets must be closed in the proper order to maintain valid nesting structure.

testCases.description: should return true for simple parentheses pair
should return true for multiple bracket types in sequence
should return false for mismatched bracket types
should return true for properly nested brackets
should return false for improperly nested brackets

product_of_array_except_self.title: Product of Array Except Self
product_of_array_except_self.description: Construct an algorithm that generates an output array where each element represents the product of all input array elements excluding the element at the current index position. The solution must operate in O(n) time complexity without utilizing division operations. Design the algorithm to handle arrays containing up to 10^5 elements with values ranging from -30 to 30, ensuring all intermediate and final products remain within 32-bit integer bounds.

parameters.name: nums
parameters.description: Array of integers where each element contributes to products at other indices

testCases.description: should return [24, 12, 8, 6] where each element is the product of all others
should return [0, 0, 9, 0, 0] handling negative numbers and zero
should return [60, 40, 30, 24] for consecutive integer sequence

three_sum.title: Three Sum
three_sum.description: Design an algorithm to identify all unique triplets within an integer array that sum to zero. Given an array of integers, return all distinct combinations of three elements where the sum equals zero and no indices are repeated. The solution must eliminate duplicate triplets from the result set. Implement an efficient approach that can handle arrays with up to 3000 elements containing values ranging from -10^5 to 10^5.

parameters.name: nums
parameters.description: Array of integers to find triplets within

testCases.description: should return [[-1, -1, 2], [-1, 0, 1]] for mixed positive and negative values
should return empty array when no valid triplets exist
should return [[0, 0, 0]] for array of all zeros

merge_intervals.title: Merge Intervals
merge_intervals.description: Construct an algorithm to consolidate overlapping intervals within a collection. Given an array of intervals where each interval is represented as [start, end], merge all overlapping intervals and return an array of non-overlapping intervals that cover the entire input range. Two intervals are considered overlapping if they share any common points, including when one interval's end equals another's start. Design an efficient solution that can handle up to 10^4 intervals with coordinates ranging from 0 to 10^4.

parameters.name: intervals
parameters.description: Array of intervals where each interval is [start, end]

testCases.description: should merge overlapping intervals [1,3] and [2,6] into [1,6]
should merge touching intervals [1,4] and [4,5] into [1,5]
should merge overlapping intervals after sorting [4,7] and [1,4] into [1,7]

group_anagrams.title: Group Anagrams
group_anagrams.description: Develop an algorithm to categorize strings into groups where each group contains anagrams of each other. Given an array of strings, identify and collect all strings that can be rearranged to form identical character sequences. Two strings are anagrams if they contain exactly the same characters with the same frequencies, but potentially in different orders. Return the grouped anagrams in any arrangement. Design an efficient solution that can process up to 10^4 strings, each containing up to 100 lowercase English letters.

parameters.name: strs
parameters.description: Array of strings to group by anagrams

testCases.description: should group anagrams correctly with mixed groups
should handle single empty string
should handle single character string
